snippet: Wednesday’s funeral rites for Margaret Thatcher, the former British prime minister, have become a matter of dispute in Whitwell, where many lost their jobs during the 1980s coal battles.
abstract: Whitwell Journal; funeral rites for former British Prime Min Margaret Thatcher do not soften resentment among miners in Whitwell, England, where many lost their jobs during Thatcher's union-busting battle to close unprofitable coal mines in 1980s.
lead_paragraph: Wednesday’s funeral rites for Margaret Thatcher, the former British prime minister, have become a matter of dispute in Whitwell, where many lost their jobs during the 1980s coal battles.

headline.seo: Thatcher Funeral Does Not Diminish Miners’ Bitterness
headline.main: As Thatcher Goes to Rest, Miners Feel No Less Bitter
headline.print_headline: As Thatcher Goes to Rest, Miners Feel No Less Bitter
